FacilityName: Buckeye Development and Logistics II - Tuscola
ParentCompanyName: Buckeye Development and Logistics II - Tuscola

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Development and Logistics, LLC - Tuscola Terminal is an on-shore propane storage and distribution facility. Propane can be received via pipeline, railcar, or truck, stored in above-ground pressurized vessels and underground LPG caverns, and distributed by railcar or truck.   The Risk Management Plan covers the above process including storage of up to 22 propane railcars, 17x 57,500 gallon propane vessels, approximately 30,240,000-gallons of cavern storage, approximately 1,500 gallons of ethyl mercaptan (used as an odorant), and associated transfer equipment, piping, and instruments.





The Buckeye Development and Logistics, LLC - Tuscola Terminal covered process is compliant with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Tuscola Fire Department and the Douglas County Emergency Management Agency, as appropriate, through the 911 Service.  The primary hospital response is provided through the Douglas County Jarman Memorial Hospital.  The Facility currently maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first responder-operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.





The covered process at Buckeye Development and Logistics, LLC - Tuscola Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor - Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).





The Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to the local r

esponders.  Additionally, the local Emergency Response Action Plan reflects the propane process.





This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the covered process that resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.





In the event of an emergency involving the covered processes at Tuscola Terminal, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Tuscola Fire Department and request their assistance.  The Facility's Emergency Response Action Plan is coordinated with the Tuscola Fire Department and the Douglas County Emergency Management Agency.  The fire department is aware of the Facility's  propane operations, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release.  The Terminal is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.





Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety.  Also, Buckeye is implementing a corporate-wide policy to include the local first responders in regular exercises and in all 3 year PSM/RMP training cycles and is developing "global" operating procedures.
